website_summaries.verdict: On the expensive side, but many users appreciate having alternative sites. We like this lancing device's versatility and nearly pain-free operation.
pros: Allows users to draw different amounts of blood
Can be used on alternative sites
cons: Vacuum pump does not always draw blood
some squeezing may still be required
Easier to use on others, not self

customer_reviews.title: It is the most painful of the lancet devices I have used.
customer_reviews.text: First issue, it says to follow link to the video to learn how to use it, it has been months, and it still says "Private video" so I can't watch it. Second, I tried all the tips, one at a time, and it is still the most painful. third, the design has the plunger popping out the top, so you have to learn to hold it with just your finger tips. and last, the trigger is in such a bad place"not recessed at all" so I have miss-fired it many, many times. I have been a diabetic for over 10 years, and my mother for more than 30 years, and neither of us find this a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Papajoe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew, he was just diagnosed with type1 diabetes with only 5 years old. It was hard to see him crying every time he had to be checked, so we find out about Genteel and we decided to try it and we love it, he love it too. My nephew already has decorated his Genteel and he is not crying or complaining every time his BG needs to be checked. Its an amazing invention, we're so happy that I also bought one for my mom who have type 2 DM. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the claim that it is painless.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Genteel Lancing Device for about a week. I have watched the YouTube video about ten times. I have followed the directions in the video. It feels like a wasp stings me every time I pull the trigger. Seldom does it produce enough blood to get a reading. I am about ready to put it in a drawer and chalk it up to $99.00 wasted. I could not recommend anyone buying the Genteel Lancing Device.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred M Parsons

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: this makes taking blood sugar so much less painfull, fson is t1d, he has always used the regular prickers cuz they were cheap. having virtually no pain is totally worth the investment. it can get complicated to use. You have to make sure you dont remove your finger from the button and pull the device away from you "poked" finger. if you do, it causes a blood spray that you have to clean out. There is a video that tells you the same thing, but when you are used to being able to poke and pull away immediately, it takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E.

customer_reviews.title: GENTEEL IS THE PROPER NAME FOR THIS LANCET
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to use on my newly diagnosed schnauzer..... yes a dog !!! He is very skittish with noises, which you al know that regular lancets make a huge SNAP sound...... Genteel makes a subtle snap and then suction to the injected site to draw blood to the surface of the skin. Now while that all may seem to be insignificant to some people, when you are dealing with a skittish dog things like a quieter snap and suction to get blood to the surface are huge deals to me. This lancet system is well worth the price..... buy one you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Works most of the time and really is pain free
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are accurate as the device is pretty much pain free. Just a very small prick sensation The only reason I gave four stars and not a five star is that I had to use the thinnest rubber cushion to draw out the blood and it doesn’t always draw out enough blood to get an accurate blood sample for the glucose reader. Given that this product cost almost $100.00 I would expect it to be work everytime. And yes I am following the instructions exactly as written.
customer_reviews.author: New York

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable device. I am new to this process and decided to take a chance on purchasing Genteel so I could check how i was doing as i was learning to adjust to my new reality. I did my research and read the reviews....i have been using it now for three weeks.. l do not feel any pain when the lance punctures my skin..ever...the most I felt is an mild itching sensation where i check.. so i have no fear..no hesitation to check..and that is good for my health!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Foster

customer_reviews.title: It Is Painless
customer_reviews.text: The user claims it is painless (so far). The vacuum does assist in drawing the blood sample, but two caveats. 1. Release the vacuum slowly once the sample is available. If you take your finger off quickly the in rushing air may scatter the sample and then it might be insufficient to allow the meter to produce a reading. 2. Make sure the location from which you are drawing the sample is as level as possible or the sample my get on the vacuum seal, again reducing the sample size available for the test. Rinse the seal each time this may happen.
customer_reviews.author: Duane P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for diabetic dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a diabetic dog not knowing much about it. But getting a drop from her was so hard. I came across Genteel in a support group and the rave reviews were real. I shaved a little area near her tail, and use the green tip with generic lances. She's a yorkie mix and doesn't mind it at all. We're officially on a schedule and once she sees this pen she knows it's almost time to eat so she's excited. If you're unsure or unable, this is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It Does What it says it does
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new diabetic and when I received my first testing kit from Free Style the pen wouldn't work. My pharmacist didn't have another one so he gave me a different brand - it wouldn't work with my lances. So I got on Amazon and found the Geenteel Lancing Device which I could get the next day and offered money back if I didn't like it. The directions are clear and it was indeed easy to use and the blood drop from it was always sufficient. I would recommend this product to anyone and have. The reason it didn't get 5 stars is that it should have an ejection for the lance pin.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has to test 3x per day and works with his hands all day. He was complaining about his fingers hurting. Compared to some of the other testers a little pricey, somethings are worth it. My family can spend more on a dinner or an outing. Since he has been using the Genteel Lancer he has not complained. This is one less discomfort that he has to worry about. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Betzy L.

customer_reviews.title: Makes BG checking a lot easier
customer_reviews.text: I had the opportunity to speak directly with the developer as I had a few "user" issues. I found the company to be truly concerned about me and my dog and dealt with me with compassion and professionalism. I have a diabetic dog I love and this had made blood drawing so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline du Mee

customer_reviews.title: A must for my sweet girl
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old has had type 1 diabetes for 10 years. Fingers were starting to become damaged from having to stick them 5 to 6 times a day. This is so much better than regular finger sticks, the vacuum suction makes it easier, so it's the right amount of blood taken. Doesn't hurt as bad as a regular one, so it's very nice for younger kids, and nice to be able to use on places other than fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for diabetic dog
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this device on my dog for 4 months now so I could truly evaluate it and I would definitely buy it again. I did have trouble at first learning how to use it and I'm not always successful on the first try but still better than the traditional lancing devices. I felt so guilty having to stick my dog repeatedly looking for blood and the genteel has cut down on that. I found the best place to draw blood on my dog is inside the ear flap. If you have a diabetic dog this device is expensive but worth the money
customer_reviews.author: SCWretiree

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Genteel. I ordered the first one directly from the Genteel company. The price is the same here. I love to be able to test on my palms with this device. Testing my fingers with other lancing devices always felt like i was hitting my fingertips with a hammer. This is way more tolerable. My choice from now on is Genteel! Love it...
customer_reviews.author: JillU

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fantastic product!!!! My dog is diabetic and we tried using a regular lancet and it was so difficult, for her and me. With the Genteel I no longer have to worry about getting blood for testing! I would highly recommend this product!! Note: This is our 2nd Genteel in a year. We purchased the 1st one in August 2017 and it only lasted until June 2018. I would have hoped, and expected, that for the price it would have lasted much longer. I did contact the company and although they tried to walk me through some fixes, none ever fixed it. Having said that I loved it enough to purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Locke

customer_reviews.title: Defective ×2 upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the product as both the original purchase and replacement purchase were both damaged. Order this in black and both times the black was scratched and firmly all over. For a $100 lancing device you would expect the product to arrive unblemished. Tried working with Amazon to work with Genteel and was offered no assistance. I was excited for this product but I will be returning it as $100 is too much to waste on a product that arrives damaged twice.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love it........I'm a big chicken when it comes to sticking my fingers. When the Dr does it it hurts like a mother f%#$@&... so I never test at home.This little thing may have saved my life. So easy and pain free. Update july 28 2020 its losing it suck.. now I cant exchange it. Hope I dont need to buy one every 3 months
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: RN bougth this for my father!! You wont regret  buying it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my father he has been a Diabetic Type II for a couple of years now. I am a pediatric registered nurse & realized how sore my patients little fingers would get due to the harsh lancets. I decided to search for something like this for my dad & glad I found it, he is happy and the best thing he said to me was “ it finally doesnt hurt to check my blood sugar” best feeling in the world! Directions are simple took me about 30 min to teach my dad.
customer_reviews.author: brenda Martinez

customer_reviews.title: My dog appreciated this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my diabetic dog and it's worth every penny. Pulled out enough blood right away and he didn't even flinch. I used it on his paw and didn't even need to shave him to use it. It's a bit pricy but totally worth it plus I'll be saving on strips because I'll know I have enough blood each time.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: We LOVED it while it worked.. after TWO months it quit working!
customer_reviews.text: I want to start by saying we ABSOLUTELY loved this lancing device. My sons pain has decreased, he is no longer terrified everytime he needs to check his blood sugar. But after ONLY TWO months of having it, it is completely useless. First the suction stopped working and now it won't prick AT ALL.. Did we get a lemon? Now my son has to go back to using the old one that bruises his finger and causes him to cry every use. This is so disappointing considering how expensive this is.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J.

customer_reviews.title: Best lancing device out there!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using OneTouch Verio Delica lancing device but was getting a lot of pain at previously used finger punch sites. Thought I would try the Genteel Lancing Device based on other good reviews. Glad I did, its really amazing, there is literally no pain, even at previous punch sites. SO glad I got this device. Really great!
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: I am Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am so lucky to have seen a report on Genteel before using the device supplied by the meter company. My only experience before purchasing Genteel is finger pricks at the doctor's office, and they frankly hurt. This device you can feel but is never hurts like the finger stab.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oldaker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot more expensive than other products but well worth it. It is truly painless and allows me to keep getting samples from the same spot on my palm. I realized that I am not awake enough to do it correctly when i first wake up in the morning. You must follow the correct steps or you will get splatter on the tip and it won't work. Truly easy once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Loud and violent
customer_reviews.text: Holy **** this thing is loud! Scares the hell out of me every time I press the button. I’m not sure what kind of gymnastics people do to use this with one hand, but it’s near impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Massive improvement over regular lancing devices
customer_reviews.text: Love this device!!! I’m the one testing my husband’s sugar levels for the time being. So many times I was lancing him on his fingers and forearms, 2 and 3 times without getting a good enough blood bead to load the test strip with....NO problems with the Genteel! We’ve switched to his palms, below the thumb and pinkie areas, he barely feels it and the vacuum pulls up a very generous blood bead every time. Well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Scheller

customer_reviews.title: Hard to depress the plunger
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Nearly impossible to get into the box without destroying it. The thing is very large compared to other devices. The plunger is hard to depress. It looks nothing like the photo. Lots of bleeding from the site on my arm. I’m not on blood thinners or anything so I’m not sure why. I’ll use it a weeks or so and see if things improve, but as of now. I don’t like it.
customer_reviews.author: GINA

customer_reviews.title: I don't like being poked and I was extremely skeptical
customer_reviews.text: I don't like being poked and I was extremely skeptical.. if not for any other reason than the simple reasoning that if this device was as good as it claimed, it would be far more in the news.. and there are too many 'fair and unbiased' scam reviews out there.. but lo and behold, it was really that good.. no pain.. amazing and worth every penny.. Thanks to the creators.. much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I did my research and came across Genteel and watched videos on YouTube of satisfied users. It is expensive for a lancing device ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to blood sugar testing and the testing device and lancets [gauge 33] l bought from the pharmacy made my finger sore for days. I developed such anxiety from the anticipated pain every time l had to draw blood that l stopped checking my blood sugar. I did my research and came across Genteel and watched videos on YouTube of satisfied users. It is expensive for a lancing device but I'm very satisfied with the very much less painful outcome. For the lancet, I use the brand tiniBoy gauge 36 with the genteel device. I have used it for alternate test sites.
customer_reviews.author: vicky

customer_reviews.title: What a Difference!!! NO PAIN!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting tired of painful fingertips. I was cautious about this and kept thinking about this Wonderful device for months and then finally purchased. What a Difference!!! From the first use to consecutive uses it gets easier and more precise and with NO PAIN. Thank You Genteel for making such a wonderful product. I will definitely tell everyone I know about this. Will definitely tell my Doctors as well.
customer_reviews.author: CMVC

customer_reviews.title: Painless on dog,
customer_reviews.text: It's what I use on my diabetic dog and he doesn't even flinch. Just had to practice a bunch of times no lancet with treats to get him used to the sound. The sound will make them flinch before the pain does. This is a terrific lancing device. Worth the money to be kind to your diabetic pet.
customer_reviews.author: tricky niki

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a quick pinch instead of an "ouch!"
customer_reviews.text: I invested in this pricey lancet device to eliminate the dread of frequent painful finger pricks. I'm very glad I did. It feels like a quick little pinch instead a painful piercing finger prick. I don't dread taking my glucose levels one bit. My only disappointment is that I find if I use alternate sites (like above the knee), I get glucose level results wildly different from those taken at fingertips. And because I know the fingertip site is likely the most accurate, I have begun to use those exclusively instead of other sites. That said, I'm still very glad I made this purchase. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JN1954

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This came highly recommended by a friend whose young daughter loves it. But I could never get it to work properly-either no blood or a gusher. Had trouble getting blood anywhere other than finger, which was my purpose in buying it.
customer_reviews.author: MomofHolly

customer_reviews.title: SO EASY AND PAIN FREE
customer_reviews.text: This device is incredible! I actually use it for my diabetic dog and it is so easy and pain free to draw his blood for testing. I can do it while he is sleeping! Prior to getting this, we really struggled and taking his blood sugar was an ordeal. Now, it’s no big deal. I have used it on myself and can attest, no paid and plenty of blood for a reading.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie whiting

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I am testing without fear.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lancing device. I can finally pick my finger without fear. It is easy to use and is painless. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jax8894

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE BUTTERFLY TOUCH LANCETS. GET THE WALGREENS BRAND.
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to try something to help the pokes. My son did not really feel a difference but I wanted to do the best thing and preserve his fingers. I really feel it did not cause less pain then the Delica One touch lancet. The Delica lancets are small and can't fit. I would try the Walgreens Lancets. The Butterfly touch lancets caused more pain then the tiniboy lancets per my son. He enjoyed decorating the device with the letter stickers and themes. That was his favorite part.
customer_reviews.author: FrenchFry

customer_reviews.title: Seriously there’s NO PAIN. At all. Not even a little!
customer_reviews.text: I was recently diagnosed with gestational diabetes and I am absolutely horrified of needles. I started to panic when i realized that I would have to be pricking my fingers multiple times each day. I am overjoyed that i found The Genteel on Amazon - you really cannot feel it and I’m very sensitive. No pain whatsoever. I’m so grateful and blown away. It really works. If you’re needle-phobic, like me, this is the lancing instrument for you!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Holy Smokes Is This Thing Real Life
customer_reviews.text: Recently diagnosed with gestational diabetes and having a fear of needles is not a good combo. Discovering Genteel was a total game changer. It's so easy to use, I didn't even feel it (and believe me I was focusing on that tiny poke waiting for it) and it's fast. Waiting 6 second is nothing when you don't feel it. I'll take that exchange any day. Don't let the price scare you, it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Have been wanting to purchase this for a while. Admittedly, it was a bit pricy for me. Saw on a FB page that it was on sale for Prime Day so I decided to go for it. I’m am mad at myself for waiting so long. It is amazing to not use your fingers. I’ve been testing for 37 years and have horrible callouses on my fingers. I finally get to give them a break. Add the fact that it’s a gorgeous pink color and I got to put a butterfly sticker on it . . . Well it’s perfect. Thanks for this device!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Villánueva

customer_reviews.title: Best device on the market!
customer_reviews.text: The Genteel lancing device is phenomenal! I purchased one for my 8-year-old granddaughter who is developing Type 1 fiabetes and recently had to start doing frequent glucose checks. She was afraid to have have her finger stuck with a lancet prior getting her Genteel. Now since she has her Genteel, she checks her blood sugar on her own and is no longer afraid. She likes to use the Genteel on areas other than her fingers. It was easy for her to learn. I would highly recommend this for anyone who has to check their blood glucose and wants it to be painless. In our case, it was well worth the money. My daughter described it as “A God send.”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY much worth the price!!
customer_reviews.text: So, when your Dr tells you it's time for regular blood glucose testing and you can't bear to do a finger prick GET THIS!! I have been able to have better compliance with my testing because this is fairly painless and I save my finger tips - which I need for my job - and I love this! It's an investment for sure, but so so so worth it! Gave my Dr the info so he could recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: TikiQ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on my dog
customer_reviews.text: Their website as advertise that it would work on dog as well. So I try. I shaved a part of my dog so the suction would work. Evening using the lowest profile suction cup, I still couldn't get blood out of him.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S

customer_reviews.title: Finally a lancet that does not hurt !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought Genteel for my diabetic dog . I had been having a lot of trouble using the lancet from Alpha track. I even tried manually trying to get enough blood for my dogs glucose curve . I was so discouraged! I did not want to hurt her anymore but had to get a curve in order to regulate her insulin . I researched lancets and saw the genteel website and watched the videos and read the reviews . I decided to give it a try . It was so easy , didn’t hurt my dog , and I was finally able to get blood . I would highly recommend this lancet !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and the only good place to prick is his tiny ear
customer_reviews.text: My little Pomeranian was recently diagnosed with diabetes, and the only good place to prick is his tiny ear. It sometimes took 2–3 sticks to get enough blood. I decided to give the Genteel a try, and after a short learning curve I highly recommend it. My sugar baby thanks you!
customer_reviews.author: Creed

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money For Less Pain
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't for the great reviews, I would not have purchased the Genteel Lancing Device. It works as advertised. It makes the smallest of holes. I don't feel anything. I use the blue tip on the fingers. The only way that I know that it has lanced me is due to the mechanism popping out in the back. I like the equipment bag included. Everything I need to monitor my glucose fits in the bag. Besides the cost, the only other con would be the size. I would hope as technology improves, that the device would get smaller and not as bulky when compared to other lancing devices.
customer_reviews.author: V McKenna

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this thing 20 stars I would
customer_reviews.text: this is very very awesome. 0 pain at all! and I am terrified of needles I actually looking forward to doing my blood and seeing my numbers
customer_reviews.author: Kathy PerryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Easy to use. Painless. I like that it can be used at locations other than fingers. Definitely recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Genteel thought of everything
customer_reviews.text: The device is constructed well and because it's adaptable, lances with no pain for the majority of my sticks. I'm not a pro with disconnecting used lancets, but I found more that fit at the local drug store. And imagine my surprise when I saw a letter of approval from diabetes doctor, R. Bernstein! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K Goldbie

customer_reviews.title: Makes testing my diabetic dog so easy
customer_reviews.text: I test my diabetic dog every 2 hours when I do a curve. The Genteel makes it so easy, so stress-free for me and my pet, and it is gentle. My dog does not even notice when I use this lancing device on him. It is a great design!
customer_reviews.author: C. Neuman

customer_reviews.title: Best Lancing Device Ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been told by the person I gifted this too that it is the BEST lancing device she has ever used...compared to all other devices...it is the closest to painless she has ever used....and she is scared of needles beyond words...and uses this without flinching...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Buikus II

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my diabetic dog and it is easy to use. The only thing that scares him is the click it makes. I wouldn't be able to do it without this device though.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Davis

customer_reviews.title: No more sore fingers
customer_reviews.text: If you are one of those people who hate sticking your fingertips, this is the product for you. I ordered this since I was tired of sore fingers. I would put off checking my blood sugar because of this. This product will let you stick yourself on your upper arm, which is far less sensitive, and get a good reading. So glad I found this. Will tell everyone I know about it.
customer_reviews.author: janet S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: excellent engineered product
customer_reviews.text: excellent engineered product. Great customer service and highly recommend even though a little pricy compared to others. However this is a one of a kind product and I haven't seen anything on market come close. Excellent job Genteel!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do what it meant to do
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work as it says or show in the video...
customer_reviews.author: FAM

customer_reviews.title: Truly pain free lancing!!
customer_reviews.text: This device is truly remarkable! I felt nothing at all when lancing my finger or arm and was shocked. It was so pain free that I thought it somehow didn't work until I pulled it up and saw a nice blood droplet. Just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: MDShavano

customer_reviews.title: Using it on a pet
customer_reviews.text: The device is straightforward and the instructions for its use are clear, though like most such devices, it takes some tweaking and practice. I am using this on a pet, so there are added concerns about sealing the vacuum, but it does result in less obvious pain to the animal
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Steve

customer_reviews.title: it's really helped my son to not have to experience ...
customer_reviews.text: it's really helped my son to not have to experience pain anymore when he checks his sugar, which is about 6 times daily. I'm thankful to know about this device!
customer_reviews.author: mykidscost2much

customer_reviews.title: Truly is almost pain free
customer_reviews.text: Well it really works. Just tried it and wow. Blood testers should buy right away. Hardest part was putting the darn tips on. Also the carry bag zipper broke immediately. Genteel you need a new bag supplier.
customer_reviews.author: ITPDenizen

customer_reviews.title: Best investment
customer_reviews.text: I use the Genteel Lancing Device on my 8 year old weimaraner who was diagnosed with Diabetes It is difficult enough to have to test a dog. I was having to stick her 4 times to get a drop of blood. I shaved a small spot under her tail and that is where I test her. She doesn't even react three pumps and I have the blood to surface. I thought it was pricey but worth every penny. Hope this helps. I would highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stringer

customer_reviews.title: This device is well worth the purchase. It saves findertips and makes testing less painful.
customer_reviews.text: After I realized that I should hold the button down for the suction to work, testing was a breeze. I highly recommend for easing the pain of testing and saving finger tips. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Designed for kiddos, PERFECT FOR DOGS❣️
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to have easier access to collect blood sugars for my dog. Performing a curb test, requires collection every 2 hours for 12 plus hours. As this is a difficult task, the entire setup is very easy to use. I am so thankful that I found this device via YouTube videos.
customer_reviews.author: Jonette Evert

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my pregnant wife who has gestational diabetes and it works great. For newbies who wants to save some pain and blood, make sure to watch the video a few times to get all the details, especially the part about remove your finger off the button and then lift. My wife practiced a few times on me before getting it right.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use....making it easier to want to test your blood.
customer_reviews.text: I was just recently diagnosed as prediabetic and was advised to start testing my blood. A friend is a Type 2 and he recommended I buy this model. He said it was probably the best change in testing he has seen in his 20 years of diabetes testing. The unit is a little pricey but I have to say I am going to buy another one if this one breaks. I don't have experience with any other model....and don't intend to compare and find out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does make blood testing less painful.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit more complicated but does make the blood test less painful. It does seem a bit expensive for most people since it is 5X the cost of a standard lancing device, but that is on the supplier and not the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne in Indy

customer_reviews.title: No more painful "pokes"!
customer_reviews.text: My greatest fear with managing my new diagnosis was the dreaded finger "poke". With Genteel I hardly feel anything and have absolutely no residual pain. It is super easy to use, I don't have to "milk" my finger to get the blood to come out. I've recommended this product to all the people I know that are living with diabetes.
customer_reviews.author: E. Selleck

customer_reviews.title: The directions were terrible. It is made of cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: The directions were terrible. It is made of cheap plastic. I already had one little break on it that causes me to adjust the way the nozzle stays on. All that being true i love it. While i still have some pain, it is reduced by at least 50%.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemens

customer_reviews.title: totally painless glucose monitoring
customer_reviews.text: I would give it ten stars if `I could. NO PAIN. My son is autistic and checking his sugar level is a breeze with this. You can take blood from just about anywhere on the hand, palm, wrist--all with no discomfort. `it creates a gentle suction which sucks the blood into a perfect little drop for the test strip. It is definitely worth it. We just went with the 10 day indwelling glucose meter but the Genteel is always #1 to me for finger and hand sticks. Stephen Kastl
customer_reviews.author: stephen c kastl

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son is 14 and was diagnosed as a Type 1 diabetic at five years old. That’s a lot of finger pricks. We watched reviews and discussed that Genteel was a bit bigger than the device he used to check his blood sugar but decided to give it a shot. It took two pricks to figure it out and it’s been smooth sailing since! He doesn’t flinch and has checked his blood sugar on his palms and thighs. He loves it! I would recommend to everyone. Thanks so much for giving his fingers a break
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: the divece did not work and they refuse to return
customer_reviews.author: Madow

customer_reviews.title: Pain free
customer_reviews.text: I tried it on me and I tried it on my husband who starts to yell ouch before the others were even near him and he never felt it ! I heard about the genteel from others and it is everything they say
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Weinberg

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Worth every penny. If it ever breaks, I'm buying 2 more. It makes checking blood sugar much easier! Believe it when they say painless!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend but has issues
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this, he says it hurts so much less. I dislike that it tends to get blood splatters in the cap and after three months the clear cap has broken and needs to be replaced. I feel this product is good but very over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It performs the way they promised. Less pain but not totally pain free for me. The needle is a little bigger than my old lancet and so more blood comes out. The trigger button is a little springy for me so I get startled sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: VEA

customer_reviews.title: We are so glad we found Genteel
customer_reviews.text: We are using Genteel for our diabetic dog. It was a nightmare to use another type of lancing device: huge stress to me and my pup. I was about to give up to take Chapa's blood glucose tests regularly. Then I found a video on youtuve where someone was using Genteel on her dog, and I decided to give it a try. It takes couple of times to learn how to use the device. I can tell that my pup doesn't feel a thing when I take a blood sample. We are so glad we found Genteel!
customer_reviews.author: maria z

customer_reviews.title: My third Genteel
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Genteel after I forgot to take my second traveling one on my recent trip. Now I have one at each home.
customer_reviews.author: dmlakl

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical, especially because of the price, but I have to say this really doesn't sting as much as other lancing machines I've used. So glad I decided to give this a try!
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me...
customer_reviews.text: I would buy this again if needed. It’s not completely painless for me on the fingertips, but the suction factor is a huge deal because it can be impossible to get enough blood out most of the time. It doesn’t leave bruising or marks like standard lancers. I mostly use it on the top of the finger, below the nail, and can barely feel a thing.
customer_reviews.author: S.S

customer_reviews.title: Test When You Need To Know, Not Based on How Much You Can Stand It
customer_reviews.text: For those who need to test more frequently to see how you react to certain foods or eating schedules, this is so helpful. As reported, it is painless. I use "micro" sized test strips and there is more than enough sample in just seconds. I felt comfortable trying out different testing sites and tips, and that helped me customize how I use it. Very easy! Reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife. Not as pain free as she was hoping. A little better but from how they market it to actual use got her hopes up a little.
customer_reviews.author: Jaypa76

customer_reviews.title: genteel
customer_reviews.text: im very happy with genteel is true painless lancing device the old one that i use every time i feel pain when i am using it but with genteel you dont feel a sting..i can prick myself 10x more a day without hesitation..thank you so much for this device just hope the price may lower down so i can buy a a spare one ..thank you genteel..more power
customer_reviews.author: casssopia

customer_reviews.title: Will always recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for my genteel! I saw so much hype online and I had to try it - so far it has met all my expectations! I love being to save my fingers from repetitive testing. The vaccum is so useful, nothing like getting the perfect drop. I'll be honest, I ordered this in white and it came in purple, but not such a big deal, I was just excited to use it. I will always recommend to my diabetic friends.
customer_reviews.author: leah

customer_reviews.title: When on a Dexcom this is a great backup if the meter has to come out
customer_reviews.text: I do not use this daily but from time to time since I wear a dexcom and this helps lance my finger to get the blood that I need
customer_reviews.author: Chris S. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive finger tips.
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to spend that much money on a lancing device. However, my fingertips are sensitive and I have always hated finger pricks. I am so glad I went for it. It is 1000x better than regular lancing device. I do not dread testing my blood sugar, and my fingers aren’t sore after the prick. If you have to test multiple times a day, I highly recommend buying the Genteel.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kahle

customer_reviews.title: Worked as Promised
customer_reviews.text: Great product - using it in a blood taking clinical trial. It was mostly pain free. The suction did help form a droplet. Would have like a larger model to collect 50-100microliters of blood per draw.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Payne

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second genteel. We love it! My two year old type 1 no longer cries and doesn't need to be held down for finger checks. We are so happy with this purchase! Worth every penny for us.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: A must for every Diabetic
customer_reviews.text: My poor baby fingers were awful, this is not as painful. Get this for your child. PERIOD!
customer_reviews.author: C Holli

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The best lancing device. My 5 year old doesn’t like pricking his fingers. We use this on his forearms and it doesn’t bother him at all. The only thing is, on his skin, it can’t leave marks after a lot of use. But it doesn’t hurt at all, so it’s totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel N Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: not as easy as advertised....
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter has only had Type 1 diabetes for a week. The device that we were sent home with was not exactly pain free. So, we starting to search for other methods in which to take a blood sample. We thought, unrealistic expectations maybe, that this would be pain free...and that she would be able to give her finger tips a break. Unfortunately this is not the case. We returned this device along with all of the lancets we purchased to go another route. I guess the moral of this story is that not one size fits all. I am sure this is a great device for most of the customers out there, just not us.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This device works as advertised. There is little or ...
customer_reviews.text: This device works as advertised. There is little or no pain. It took a little while to figure out how to use it. For instance, keep you hands away from the plunger because it pops up. No complaints. I would but it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Missing bag and Lancets
customer_reviews.text: This works great, but didn't receive the carrying case or test lancets )0:
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Not as useful as expected
customer_reviews.text: This device is expensive and doesn't work all too well most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: WaltyS

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Using with tini boy lancet. Barely feel the poke! Expensive but worth it if you don't like the traditional lancing devices.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Diabetes is bad enough, taking out the pain of sampling is a small thing but even a little pain is worth eliminating.
customer_reviews.text: If you are diabetic like me your fingers are constantly sore. The Genteel is a finger saver with no pain and a suction that will draw blood from my thumb and because fewer surface nerves I hardly know that I use the same thumb 4X a day,
customer_reviews.author: Arthur R Cutler

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome! Got this for my daughter to use on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! Got this for my daughter to use on her diabetic dog . The lancet that came with the vetinary glucose monitoring kit was impossible. My daughter was so discouraged and we could absolutely not get any blood and causing poor Sam pain.This Genteel device is a lifesaver!! Easy to use, gets the blood needed and completely painless! Thank you! Highly recommend and wish we had found sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: slr

customer_reviews.title: No more finger pricking!
customer_reviews.text: My wife hated pricking her fingers everytime she has to test. Now I can do it quickly for her on her back and she doesn't even notice! It's great!
customer_reviews.author: George 47

customer_reviews.title: A+++
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my dad. Great product and seller! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Julius Omony

customer_reviews.title: So much easier and less painful! Really improved my testing experience
customer_reviews.text: So much easier and less painful! Really improved my testing experience! The company stresses that you watch the video, and I agree it was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good lancing tool
customer_reviews.text: This was the first lancing device that I have ever purchased. It did cost a bit more but it is easy to use and provides a low pain when used. I would purchased again.
customer_reviews.author: Missouri Shopper 2016

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this device. He was having trouble ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this device. He was having trouble getting blood from his finger with another device. Now using this he does not have to stick but once.
customer_reviews.author: urabsdi

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price, no less sticks
customer_reviews.text: More difficult to use than it looks even with the step by step video. Takes pricking yourself too many times to set it up. Then once you change lancets your have to set the depth all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne LeeAnn Higgins

product_meta.title: Genteel Lancing Device (Willowy White)
feature_bullets: Get the perfect drop of test blood without pain
Uses depth control, vacuum, and vibration
Test on the palm to give your fingers a break
Uses widely available generic square-shaft lancets
Decorative stickers for kids to personalize

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
